intro: Gymnosporia obbiadensis, commonly known as the Natal silver tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Fabaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and distinctive, spiny trunk. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes, followed by small, leathery pods containing seeds. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient shrub or small tree. Gymnosporia obbiadensis plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
